alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Chatanika River Valley; Dalton Highway Summits; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; South Slopes Of The Central Brooks Range; South Slopes Of The Eastern Brooks Range; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Koyukuk Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River; Yukon Flats (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 29 at 7:42PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Another Arctic Blast Tuesday Night Into the Weekend... After the brief "warm-up" from the bitterly cold temperatures recently, another prolonged cold-snap will return to the Interior. Interior valley locations will fall back to -40 F to -50 F (some Interior cold spots will reach into the -55 F range, including Tanana, Fort Yukon, Coldfoot and Wiseman, and Arctic Village) for overnight lows, with high temps struggling to warm much beyond -30 F. Even the higher elevation Hills will fall back to near -40 F for low temps. This second significant cold snap will last through Saturday night before a gradual moderation in temperatures as the arctic low exits back into Canada. Residents should prepare as needed for yet another old-fashioned Interior Alaska cold snap and have necessary cold weather gear available.
